translated: And the fruit of well-performed deeds is not lost.🔽All those who have eaten the food of Sudhāmā

analyzed: sabbā iva te inda sahabyatam gatā
translated: Have gone to be the companions of Indra.
Hīḷī was Uppalavaṇṇā,
Kosiya was the donor, the monk,
Anuruddha was Pañcasikha,
and Ānanda was Mātali.
Kassapa the monk was the sun,
Moggallāna was the moon,
Sāriputta was Nārada,
and Vāsava was the Buddha.”
